body.p:
State of Kentucky, County of Franklin towit.
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette.

Your petitioners would respectfully State that John O. Stigers was fined by the Franklin circuit court, in the year 1864 Sixty dollars as we are informed, for retailing liquor without, license. He alleges that he made application to Judge Swigert for license, and was advised by him not to take them out. Accordingly he did not, and sold out his barrel of whiskey & moved off to the State of Indiana. His health has become feeble, and he is now old & infirm and can but illy spare the money to pay the fine, and your petitioners are of opinion that it would be a charitable act to remit Said fine, or rather that portion of it that is due to the Commonwealth. And your petitioners as in duty bound will ever pray &C.

Henry Bohannon
H R Wolfe
Able Armstrong
B F Sheets
Ed. Keenan
R T Coleman
C. N, Johnston
Noah Goins
W H. Gray
H. G. Banta,
J M Todd
W A Gaines
A. Bachmann
William Craik
William Brewer
R. E. Collins
A P Rogers
G. W. Rogers
Geo. W. Ward
Wm Vardiman

Franklin county Ky
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlet

your petitioner would State that since begining to get up the within petition that John O Stigers died on the 13th day of November last and as the Administrator of the Decd do I ask to be released from the penalties of the within ^named^ fine or rather that portion of it that is due to the commonwelth and your petitioner as in duty bound will Ever pray, &C. This 18th day of Jan 1866

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
John O. Stigers
$60
Remitted 1 Mar 1866
